Adding chainFamily to metrics exposed by OCR3 promwrapper. That way we will be able to distinguish between chains with clashing IDs (for instance, Aptos Mainnet has the same chainID as Ethereum Mainnet)

We will follow the same labeling strategy as we have in core metrics exposed by different components e.g., https://github.com/smartcontractkit/chainlink-framework/pull/38/files

```
prs.title: [backports] op-deployer/v0.2.0 support custom opcm
prs.truncated_body:
This pr was created by the following command, with cherry-picks the same change from the `backports/op-deployer/v0.3.0` branch:
```
git cherry-pick fed79f58d4ea1840d6f2dd506d48c4872294bc17
```

# Tests
Manually tested deploying a new op chain using the following sequence:

1. bootstrap superchain
```
go run ./cmd/op-deployer bootstrap superchain \
  --l1-rpc-url=$SEPOLIA_RPC_URL \
  --

commits.message:
[backports] op-deployer: Support custom OPCM (#16546)

* op-deployer: Support custom OPCM (#15623)

* op-deployer: use w3 instead of ReadSuperchainDeployment script

* op-deployer: Fix intent validation with pre-deployed OPCM (#15712)

* op-deployer: Fix intent validation with pre-deployed OPCM

Previously, users were always required to provide the `SuperchainRoles` in their intent. Now that the intent supports providing an OPCM address, this is no longer necessary since we can look those values up on chain. The lookup was implemented in #15623, however users still had to provide `SuperchainRoles` in their intent to avoid validation errors.

The new logic is as follows:

- `standard` intents **must** specify the correct, standard OPCM address for the specified L1 and contracts version. Anything else is an error.
- All other intent types must **either** specify `SuperchainRoles`, or an OPCM address. Specifying both or neither will result in an error.
- The deployment pipeline will always pull `SuperchainRoles` data from the chain if the OPCM address is specified. Previously, it would only do this if the OPCM address was specified _and_ the L1 locator was a tag.

* cr updates

* op-deployer: fix OPCMImplAddressFor

* remove unused ReadSuperchainDeployment.s.sol script

---------

Co-authored-by: Matthew Slipper <me@matthewslipper.com>

prs.title: fix(kt-devnet): improve compatibility with devnet-sdk system tests
prs.truncated_body:
<!--
Contributions welcome! See https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/.github/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

**Description**

Unfortunately we've backed into devnet-sdk system tests unsafe
assumptions around the first node being a sequencer.
This change attempts to restore some compatibility with these
assumptions, until we finally deprecate the old framework.
Devstack on the other hand should no

commits.message:
fix(kt-devnet): improve compatibility with devnet-sdk system tests

Unfortunately we've backed into devnet-sdk system tests unsafe
assumptions around the first node being a sequencer.
This change attempts to restore some compatibility with these
assumptions, until we finally deprecate the old framework.
Devstack on the other hand should not be affected at all.

prs.title: runtime: fix restrict violation in fd_log_address_type
prs.truncated_body:
We were allocating both `out` and `base_addr` from the same `spad` allocator, and then passing in `base_addr` to `snprintf` which was writing back into `out`. This meant the compiler couldn't guarantee that `out` and `base_addr` didn't overlap. To fix this we use a stack-allocated buffer for `base_addr`. For correctness we also change fd_log_address_type to be a macro.

Fixes some GCC builds.

commits.message: runtime: fix restrict violation in fd_log_address_type

prs.truncated_body:
We don't change or touch the smart contracts, nor is it part of the beacon-kit domain, however, it influences our coverage report. 
I want our coverage report to be a high signal metric that we can use to reference the health of our code and this moves us closer to that.

prs.title: chore(payload): do not query state when building RequestPayload
prs.truncated_body:
This PR simplifies and fixes some code path related to block building, which are prerequisites for block state caching in https://github.com/berachain/beacon-kit/pull/2812. It does the following:

- It stops blockBuilder from accessing blockchain state when building the next block payload. There are cases where next block payloads are built concurrently and access to blockchain state is not safe

prs.title: fix: #6213 handle downloader errors in btc reorg logic
prs.truncated_body:
### Description

This PR fixes the issue surfaced in #6213: the handling of an error in burn block downloading _during_ a reorg.

As sort of mentioned in the issue, the problem here is:

1. When processing a reorg, the headers db immediately handles it by dropping blocks.
2. In _that_ invocation of the bitcoin sync pipeline, the sync height is set to the common ancestor, which is good.
3.

commits.message: fix: #6213 handle downloader errors in btc reorg logic

prs.title: feat: add `--hex-file <file_path>` option to blockstack-cli contract-call
prs.truncated_body:
### Description

This change, add `--hex-file <file_path>` option to `blockstack-cli contract-call` that allows to allow a serialized Clarity value by file.

This is useful in case the value is great enough to not fit in the command-line.

It can be used like this:

```
blockstack-cli contract-call \
    ... \
    --hex-file /path/to/value.hex
```

### Applicable issues

- fixes #6

commits.message: feat: add -xf <file> option to  lockstack-cli contract-call command, #6193
refactor: convert to long flag --hex-file <file> option, #6193
crc: split unit test in two, #6193

prs.title: chore: Split deposit and withdrawal status on Emily
prs.truncated_body:
## Description

Closes: #1693

## Changes

Now Emily have two structs `DepositStatus` and `WithdrawalStatus` instead of old `Status` (same for `StatusEntry`). As for now they differ because deposits can have `RBF` status while withdrawals can't, and this split protect us from invalid state (withdrawal with `RBF` status) on compiler level.

## Testing Information

Refactoring. No new test

prs.title: Fix bug in F3 stop and use start/stop in catchup tests
prs.truncated_body:
Fix a bug where F3.Stop was never calling `stopInternal` which actually resets the state and stops the internal components.

Remove the testing API exposed for pause resume in favor of stop start. Because, now that manifest is final, there's no pause/resume and the scenario that was being tested is irrelevant. Instead, stop the nodes completely then start them back up to assert that they do catc

commits.message:
Fix bug in F3 stop and use start/stop in catchup tests

Fix a bug where F3.Stop was never calling `stopInternal` which actually
resets the state and stops the internal components.

Remove the testing API exposed for pause resume in favor of stop start.
Because, now that manifest is final, there's no pause/resume and the
scenario that was being tested is irrelevant. Instead, stop the nodes
completely then start them back up to assert that they do catch up.

The flaky test was repeated for 10 minutes on CI without failing.

Fixes: #1025

prs.title: remove subnet-evm specific warp test components
prs.truncated_body:
## Why this should be merged

Withe #1000 we have created a dependency to Subnet-EVM: e2e tests are using same AvalancheGo version as in the coreth's go.mod under the hood. A change in AvalancheGo version in Coreth might not compatible with a Subnet-EVM version. So Coreth's e2e test requires a compatible Subnet-EVM (with updated AvalancheGo), which blocks the development on Coreth side until it'

commits.message: remove subnet-evm specific warp test components

prs.title: chore: accept -alpha.N and -beta.N pre-release tags
prs.truncated_body:
### Motivation

Tags like `v0.64.0-alpha.1` would fail to build an image because "alpha" is not accepted, only "rc".

### Acceptance Criteria

- Adjust the parsing of tags to accept `-alpha.N` and `-beta.N` in addition to the current `-rc.N`

### Checklist

- [x] If you are requesting a merge into `master`, confirm this code is production-ready and can be included in future releases as s

prs.title: chore: Assess fractional fees relative to non-exempt credits and debits
prs.truncated_body:
**Description**:
  - Instead of computing the amount to reclaim for a non-`netOfTransfer` fractional fee from the size of each debit, and then reclaiming from only non-exempt credits (source of exploit); we now,
     1. Compute the fraction of the non-exempt debits that each debit makes up; then,
     2. Reclaim that fraction of the non-exempt credits.
 - Instead of repeatedly reclaiming from

commits.message:
Assess fractional fees relative to non-exempt credits and debits

prs.title: sale price type to u128
prs.truncated_body:
<!-- Thank you for your interest in contributing to OpenZeppelin! -->

<!-- Consider opening an issue for discussion prior to submitting a PR. -->
<!-- New features will be merged faster if they were first discussed and designed with the team. -->

Fixes #255 

Changes `sale_price` type from `u32` to `u128` in order to support a wider range, due to Stellar has 7 decimals for actual prices.

prs.title: Conversion to dtoken
prs.truncated_body:
## Description

Closes: *#XXXX*

This PR adds support for users to convert their existing lockups into dtoken.

New execute methods:
- set_drop_token_info: allows admin to set the drop info needed for conversion and query
- convert_lockup_to_dtoken: allows users to execute conversion

New query method:
- query_simulate_dtoken_amounts: allows users to simulate how much dtokens would they

commits.message: convert lockup to dtoken - initial logic

- refined convert_lockup_to_dtoken
- implemented reply logic which works for each reply_id (lock id) like this:
 - for given lock id unvotes are processed (if there were votes)
 - lock entry is updated with new - converted denom and amount
 - it is voted again for the same prop id with new updated lock entry (if there were votes beforehand)

prs.title: feat: add test for reward withdrawal of 0 ADA in stake operations
prs.truncated_body:
- Introduced a new test case `test_reward_withdrawal_zero` to validate the functionality of withdrawing 0 ADA rewards after stake and vote delegation.
- Updated the README to include the new test command for running this specific scenario.
- Adjusted the order of the existing test to maintain proper execution sequence.

commits.message:
feat: add test for reward withdrawal of 0 ADA in stake operations

- Introduced a new test case `test_reward_withdrawal_zero` to validate the functionality of withdrawing 0 ADA rewards after stake delegation.
- Updated the README to include the new test command for running this specific scenario.
- Adjusted the order of an existing test to maintain proper execution sequence.
